website_summaries.verdict: Great for both camping and covering vehicles, F&J Outdoors’ tarps are a nice mid-range option for protection from water, sun, and mildew.
pros: Forest green color blends in with nature

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Tarp is heavy duty and I had high hopes for it being waterproof as advertised. After 2 days of rain there was some minor puddling in one section where the tarp was not taught. The fact that the water puddled was encouraging, however when I removed the tarp, a significant amount of water had soaked through. Still a really nice, heavy duty tarp but I feel it's false advertising saying it's waterproof when it is only water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina C.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is sturdy! Worth $$$
customer_reviews.text: I live in off base military housing where I hear it's not aloud to drill into the wood to add covering. So I got heavy duty zip ties and strapped this thing down to keep my patio area cool. I live in San Diego where it's hot alot. So far it's doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Lolie

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy duty real canvas tarp
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. Heavy-duty and should last basically forever. If the waterproofing ever does come off you can just melt beeswax and put on there and it will be waterproof forever. I bought this for underneath my tent when camping because the water does come up and penetrate from The Damp ground but now I think I may hang it above the tent for when we get the heavy rains because it appears to be able to handle the heavy winds that we get in our rain storms in southeast Oklahoma. I am really pleased with the quality of this tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Klingler LLC

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF ! BARELY WATER RESISTANT
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a sturdy tarp that will likely be durable. But it is in no way waterproof and hardly water resistant. After some on and off rain showers today, water is dripping through it all over. Going to have to put a poly tarp over it to keep the area dry. It's a waste of money if your hoping to protect anything from getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Porcaro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought to cover my swim dock. Had tapered to shed water and one comer ripped-no animals just came apart. Also live in Mn you get 30 days to return. Wtf it’s snow covered for 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: tmurphy

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof or weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover some outdoor furniture which is under some tree shade so it gets a little rain shelter already. Left it next to the furniture for a day in the sun, all exposed areas sunbleached within a day. Covered the furniture anticipating rain. In 1, 20-30 minute medium to light rainfall and everything was wet underneath. I am super confused, a cotton blanket seems like it would’ve done a better job. Wish I’d have been able to use it earlier I would’ve returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea R Phegley

customer_reviews.title: A good buy, as described
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed to cover our little fishing boat. As described and at a better price than the one we bought directly from a boat supply company.
customer_reviews.author: BoCoMoMom

customer_reviews.title: Sun fades quickly
customer_reviews.text: It sun fades quickly but seems good other than that. Hopefully it's more UV resistant then the fading implies.
customer_reviews.author: Radovan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Value!
customer_reviews.text: As described Great value Not as heavy duty as thought, still seems durable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Duty
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but is is made of durable and flexible material.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Luv!

customer_reviews.title: It’s good and durable
customer_reviews.text: Awesome I like the color I like the durability It looks good and keeps my wood dry
customer_reviews.author: Anna Schorno

customer_reviews.title: Use all the o rings.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the o rings. Enable me to tie tarp down securely. Used to cover furniture for a move from Illinois to Tennessee.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Basselen

customer_reviews.title: good heavy tarp
customer_reviews.text: I tarped a utility trailer and drove 1000 plus miles at over 70 mph the whole way. Tarp weight and strength of grommets were critical in successful trip.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great tarp. D ring shackles are the way to go
customer_reviews.author: johnnyquickreader

customer_reviews.title: Fading Tarp
customer_reviews.text: Nice color when it came, but it has faded terribly. I wish we hadn’t bought it,
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA? NO. This is made in China.
customer_reviews.text: This product is made in China. One of the main reason I bought this regardless of high price was that this was advertised as made in USA. (Please read Q&A).
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great for our use
customer_reviews.text: We use these to provide coverage for our roosters. Strong and tough in winds.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I used it for.
customer_reviews.text: Used for a visual blind around my hot tub, perfectly fits the frame of my 12 X 12 canopy. Split down the middle makes 2 sides.
customer_reviews.author: vancouvr

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: Not water resistant or repellent at all !! Wasted money !!
customer_reviews.author: Javier m.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted to cover a cord of wood. The large size provides an excellent cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wind and sun resistant.
customer_reviews.text: Cover for dog run. West sun, very hot seven months. Durability unknown at this rime.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: Does what it said it would do.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tarp, stops water and does what it is suppose to do. Should have bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Water resistant! Not water proof.
customer_reviews.text: People need to understand terminology. Water will run off of this tarp and keep things under it dry, but if you leave dips in the tarp for water to puddle, it will leak. use common sense people. This is a great tarp when used appropriately! I wanted green, but when I keyed on green, it said brown in the description. I ordered it and did get the green I wanted. Very happy with this tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy as all get-out
customer_reviews.text: You just can't beat real canvas tarps. This is a heavy-duty tarp. I used it to cover an old canvas tent that is breaking down and starting to leak. This kept the rain off the tent. With the new tarp, water will bead and run off easily. For me it is still new so I will have to look up the manufacturers recommendations for keeping it water resistant in the years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Wrenn

customer_reviews.title: Bought this tarp to use as a floor in my Kodiak tent
customer_reviews.text: This tarp fit perfectly when used as a floor in my 10x14 ft Kodiak flex bow tent. The OEM floor was over $130.00 dollars and essentially a white canvas tarp. This tarp provides protection and easy clean up when used on the inside of my tent.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: It faded noticeably within one week out in the sun.
customer_reviews.text: It seems durable. But as far as UV resistant, I’m not sure. It faded noticeably within one week out in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Water Resistant
customer_reviews.text: Rain runs off this tarp except in the areas where something is touching it underneath. It probably need some additional treatment before being waterproof. Good quality tarp, thick canvas.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Poland

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, heavy weight, very durable
customer_reviews.author: Terry A. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tarp
customer_reviews.text: This heavy duty tarp is indeed heavy duty, appears durable, and I love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Wonenberg

customer_reviews.title: Good tarp.
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy material, right size, good gromets. Only issue is fading in SW desert sun; but everything does and not an issue me.
customer_reviews.author: JB Relax

customer_reviews.title: excdellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Ver y well made. Extremely durable, heavy duty. Will withstand tough conditions. Great buy! We bought this to cover an antique car...
customer_reviews.author: vj

customer_reviews.title: the durability and the fact is very good in rainy weather. Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain about this product. This type of tarp in my opinion is one the best. Excellent water proofing..
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

product_meta.title: Canvas Tarps Truck Tarp Waterproof UV Resistant 10 OZ Heavy Duty Tarpaulin Cover for Car Boat Camping Firewood Woodpile, 10x12 Feet
product_meta.description: Size Name:10 x 12 feet| Color Name:Olive greenKing Tarpaulin 6 ft. W x 8 ft. L Heavy Duty Canvas Tarpaulin Brown
feature_bullets: Truck tarps heavy duty: 10oz heavy duty canvas material (the thickness is equivalent to 23.62 mils), water resistant, anti-UV.
The grommets are distributed every 2 feet on four sides of the tarp to allow you to reinforce the tarpaulin.
Canvas tarp 10x12: The size is finished size rather than cut size. The truck tarp does not become smaller because of the seams, so you can get the size you need.
Durable and rugged tarps: Triple Thick Hems process, it has good tear resistance.
Multiple Use: Cover trucks, machinery and equipment, building materials, firewood/woodpile, boats, patio area etc. It can also be used as a water-repellent cloth for outdoor tents during camping.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars242 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
